Name: Epic of the Blazing Sun - Chapter III
StateKeyPattern: 剧情_2_5_七丘主线_下半间章_8_1

Chapters.Title: Epic of the Blazing Sun - Chapter III

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You accept the noble's trials. Though "trials" is too fine a word for something intended only to break you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Outside the walls of Septimont City lies a wasteland plagued by the Dark Tide, your homeland.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's now different from the home you remember.
Returning home, you can't help but feel sentimental.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
They say a ferocious Lion Beast corrupted by the Dark Tide prowls deep within a cave.
No common blade can cut through its skin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your first trial is to slay that beast. The noble, however, decides to strip you of all equipment but a dull sword.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have no choice but to accept.
A dull sword is more than enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The mountain trail winds like a serpent. Among the charred tree stumps, dozens of bleached skeletons lie scattered.
You suspect you're getting close as you continue forward against the unpleasant smell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
When the first rays of sunlight split the clouds,
the cave reveals itself, breathing death.
Before you get a clear picture of the cave,
a crushing force presses down upon you.

"Shhh, get down! You trying to get yourself killed?
Hold your breath or you'll alert it!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You turn around and see a hunter.
Just then, a massive beast roars and walks past where you are hiding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the Lion Beast has left, you apologize to the hunter. It was thanks to him the beast did not notice you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Going by those clothes, you're a Septimont Gladiator, eh?
Heh, I used to be just like you.
Lost a big match, got tossed out by the nobles, and ended up like this. We're nothing but their playthings."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The skills honed for battle are now merely tools for survival. Septimont has abandoned the strength it desperately needs.
You pity such reality.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ask the hunter about the Lion Beast.
Ask the hunter what you should do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Only a madman would go after that lion."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His words are rough, but he eventually tells you everything he knows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You bid the hunter farewell and make preparations for the hunt.
To gain more knowledge of your "prey," you choose to silently observe the Lion Beast in the following days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After a few days, you've managed to grasp an overall behavior pattern of the Lion Beast. Thus, you march towards the deep cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Deep within the cave's dark embrace, you tread softly.
Then, a sudden dread freezes your steps.
Between the flickering torch flames, a monstrous shape appears: the Lion Beast.
Fire from the nether dances amid its golden mane, while claws like scythes tear wounds in the earth.

Options.PlotLineKey: Draw your sword and strike the Lion Beast.
Maintain distance and swing your sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you expected, your sword fails you.
It's ineffective against the lion.
Before you can take a breath, the lion's thunderous roar storms you again.
You decide to...

Options.PlotLineKey: Dodge its attack and search for a weak point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"No good, can't find an opening...
It's moving faster and reaching further. Can't keep this up."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"If strength alone isn't enough...
Perhaps... I can borrow some help..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Just before the Lion Beast pounces at you, you slash with all your strength at the stalactite above.
It crashes down into the lion's gaping jaws.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You land on its neck. It lunges to seize you, but your swift dodges force its claws into a deadly knot around its throat.
Seeing your chance, you give a final pull, and the beast strangles itself in a frantic struggle.

Options.PlotLineKey: Guess using the environment is one way to do it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The trial has ended, and you drag your exhausted body towards the stream. Clear water cascades down into the mountain valley, and the dense forest slumbers quietly in nature's cradle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You rinse your blood-stained hands in the water.
The clear stream slowly turns red.
The birds scatter and the fish vanish.
You sense the forest's unease at your presence.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are they afraid of my power?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The critters' panic plunges you into reflection. For the first time, you realize that power can instill fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
With no time to rest, you approach the nobleman again.
He imposes the second trial upon you.

Options.PlotLineKey: I know full well the next one won't be easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old-school Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Killing a mad beast is hardly an achievement. I'm sure you're aware, girl, that all the warriors of Septimont have 'two lives.'"

Options.PlotLineKey: Cato seemed to mention this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old-school Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "One by their parents, and the other by their sword. You may consider the sword in a Gladiator's hand as their 'life' in the arena."

Dialogues.Speaker: Old-school Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"For your second trial... Bring me one hundred 'lives.'
Yes, prove to me you are worthy of standing in the arena."

Options.PlotLineKey: Turn with disgust as you wave to accept.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
To get the "admission pass" for the Agon, you start the second trial.
Day after day, you fight Gladiators of Septimont.
As your reputation grows, so do the spectators.
They don't care who you are, but only want to see when you will fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Septimontian Onlookers
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Look, it's that girl again.
Didn't think she would get as many wins as she did.
Just look at the size of her. How will she even carry those swords?"

Options.PlotLineKey: Focus on the opponent before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You have grown used to this kind of noise.
The deafening cheers numb your fatigue.
Your sword now rests against your opponent's throat.

Options.PlotLineKey: Spare the opponent and wait for the next challenger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
One by one, the Gladiators you've challenged grow in numbers.
Those you've defeated kneel before you, offering their swords symbolizing their honor with both hands.

Options.PlotLineKey: Steadily plant the opponent's sword into the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Even in Septimont, there's a limit to opponents that prove a challenge to you. Eventually, you will need to seek out tougher challengers.
You have targeted Viktor, a frequent champion of the Agon from one of the noble houses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Noble's Servant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Do you have any idea who Viktor's father is?
His lordship is the largest sponsor of the Agon."

Dialogues.Speaker: Noble's Servant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Power, wealth, those aren't things brute strength can rival.
Viktor has the best mentor, the finest weapon..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The house behind Viktor comes to you with an offer.
A perfect job and a substantial fortune, if you walk away from the duel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reject the bribe without a second thought. Humiliated, the noble's servant spits curses in your face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Noble's Servant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"You ignorant country peasant.
Do you know what it means to refuse a noble?
Hmph, then you shall suffer for your arrogance. When the time comes, don't expect any pity as you won't be getting any."

Options.PlotLineKey: Eye the scion beside the servant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scion silences the rambling servant and tears up the contract.

Dialogues.Speaker: Viktor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Let's go. There is no point in talking sense into an ignorant fool. Then again, I'd appreciate it if you don't waste too much of my time in the arena."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They throw a bag of Credits as a way to humiliate you, following it up with sarcasm and mocking gestures. They attempt to overwhelm you with their pride.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The day arrives. Viktor accepts your challenge with his honor of nobility as the stake.
You remember well the haughty look he wore but a few days prior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
But the nobles wield only words, not swords. Viktor knows nothing about swordsmanship.
You easily defeat the weak, incompetent scion, and casually lift his pretty helmet with the tip of your sword.

Options.PlotLineKey: Stare at the watching nobles with contempt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"I have won. And I achieved it without wasting your time.
Do you see? Your gilded lies shatter before real strength!"

Options.PlotLineKey: Toss the helmet back to Viktor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The crowd erupts in cheers and applause. The nobles, unable to deny your triumph, lower their heads.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You return to your lodging to count your trophies: ninety-nine swords, ninety-nine opponents defeated.
Now, only one "life" is left to claim...
Most Gladiators have long feared your reputation and dare not challenge you, except one...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Aridel, the rising star of the underground arena.
Unlike you, he was born with powerful Forte. He is undoubtedly the "king" of the arena.

Options.PlotLineKey: Talents no longer matter to me.
A sword tempered by countless battles is no less sharp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Amidst the endless chanting of the name "Aridel,"
you arrive as promised.

Options.PlotLineKey: As always, spectators crowd the arena.
Even the old-school noble is present this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your opponent's towering physique dwarfs yours, and his crushing presence brings to mind the fearsome Lion Beast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After several exchanges, you notice something unusual.
The floor is too slippery to gain a foothold,
and Aridel's armor is unusually heavy...
You are all too familiar with the nobles' despicable tricks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You then shift your pace,
luring Aridel into the very trap meant for you.
After a few more rounds, his steps grow loose, his reactions sluggish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your sword stops just before the neck of Septimont's strongest Gladiator. The entire arena falls silent, and almost immediately, the crowd erupts into applause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Spectators
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Stab! Stab! Stab..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Spectators
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Kill! Kill! Kill..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Aridel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Aridel closes his eyes and accepts his fate)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In front of everyone's watchful eye, you only take Aridel's sword.
You then bow towards the audience before turning to leave.

Options.PlotLineKey: You feel a sense of relief.

Dialogues.Speaker: Spectators
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Live! Live! Live!"

Options.PlotLineKey: Look back at the crowd and wave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next day, you arrive before the old-school nobles with one hundred "lives."

Dialogues.Speaker: Old-school Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"Hmph, Aridel is merely made of Septimontian flesh.
Above him stands a far greater force."

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm ready for the third trial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old-school Noble
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Your third trial is to earn the blessing of <ano=Lioness of Glory>Arsinosa</ano>."

Options.PlotLineKey: He never planned to let me pass the trial...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
"I know Arsinosa. It has never tasted defeat.
People say it's a peak no humans can ever reach. The last wall of Septimont. But..."

Options.PlotLineKey: I have no reason to yield!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nestor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
It is this insurmountable challenge that stirs the thirst for victory in your blood.
You accept the third trial:
To confront the guardian of Septimont, Arsinosa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta accepts the nobleman's trials. The first trial is to slay a Lion Beast corrupted by the Dark Tide. The second trial is to take the swords from one hundred Gladiators... Augusta completes the first two trials through her astonishing will and honed skills. The old-school nobleman is left embarrassed and enraged by this and imposes the final trial—challenge Arsinosa and gain her approval. Augusta knows the nobleman set these trials merely for entertainment, to enjoy the weak struggle, but she has no choice but to accept.
